quest.name: My Dear Brother
journal: This somber sibling is looking to leave Castrum Oriens.
objectives: Speak with the somber sibling at Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Erm, pardon me. Are you by chance an adventurer? Please, if you're heading to Rhalgr's Reach I beg of youâ”€take me with you!

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: My brother was a member of the Resistance, you see, and I planned to go and see him. Yet no matter how many times I explain myself, this bully of a soldier continues to keep me hostage here.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02873
dialogue.text: I've had enough of your dramatics. No one is keeping you hostage. You're free to return home, but until the area is safe, civilians are not permitted beyond the grounds of this base. End of discussion.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Well, what if I were to go in the company of this adventurer?

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02873
dialogue.text: I suppose that would be permissible. That is assuming, of course, shehe consents to be your escort.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Then it's settled! Let's be on our way, shall we? The path south through Bittermill is probably safest.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02873
dialogue.text: She seemed terribly troubled when she first arrived. Certainly in no state to be traveling alone. I have no doubt you can keep her safe, but please do keep a close eye on her.

dialogue.name: LIBERATOR02873
dialogue.text: For the last time, we cannot permit you to leave Castrum Oriens. It's not safe.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Castellum Velodyna... That soldier was telling me the Garleans built that fortress atop the bridge and changed its name.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: It's only a name, but it always starts with something small, or so my brother used to say. Piece by piece they replace what is ours with theirs. As time passes, people forget. Eventually, what was once insufferable is accepted as normal...

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: But enough of my musings. We should be going. Would it be alright if we rest on the bridge to the north?

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I sometimes wonder what it would have been like to grow up here. My brother and I were born in Ala Mhigo, but by the grace of Rhalgr we escaped shortly before the Garleans' occupation.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: We lived here for such a brief time it's hard for me to truly say this was ever our home.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: My brother, on the other hand, had been up in arms about reclaiming our home for as long as I can remember. No sooner had he heard of the Resistance than he was rushing out our door and out of Gridania.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: <sigh> Sometimes I wonder if he was right. What do you think?

dialogue.name: CHOICE1Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: CHOICE1A1
dialogue.text: Home is where you were born.

dialogue.name: CHOICE1A2
dialogue.text: Home is where you were raised.

dialogue.name: CHOICE1A3
dialogue.text: Home is where the heart is.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: You sound like my brother. I can't say that I agree, but I understand why you might say so.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: So you feel the same as I do. My brother would likely disagree.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Where the heart is? My, what a novel idea.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Though I suppose in the end there is likely no true answer we can all agree on.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I suppose we should keep moving. Would it be alright if we stopped briefly near the temple further north?

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: My parents brought me here once when I was a child. It seems my brother came here often after joining the Resistance.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: In his letters he would tell me how after every battle he came to pray. He would stay until he regained peace of mind, and stillness within his spirit.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: You've the look of a womanman who's seen their fair share of battle. Do you have such a place to return to? A place to still your mind?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A1
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.name: CHOICE2A2
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Is it a place you can call home? Is there someone there waiting for you?

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Not even a place to call home? Is there no one who waits for your return? No one who...

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: ...My apologies. That was rude of me to ask.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I have no church or temple to turn to for solace, but I do have family waiting for me at home in Gridania. Though I long to return to them I must first see my brother.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Come, we're nearly to Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: We've made it. Rhalgr's Reach...

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I realize you must have places to go, but would you accompany me inside? My brother's supposed to be in a place they call Recompense.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Oh, Brother... I meant to come sooner. When they told me the news I couldn't believe it.

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: Why? Why did you have to leave?

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I constantly ask myself how we could have grown so far apart? Why would he refuse to accept Gridania as our home?

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I hoped he would be a brother to my husband, an uncle to my son. Instead he chose Ala Mhigo. And now...

dialogue.name: SISTER02873
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. This must all seem a terrible bother. I won't keep you any longer. Thank you for bringing me here.
